intro: Commidendrum robustum, commonly known as the Natal daisies, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and bright yellow to orange flower heads that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is adapted to full sun exposure. It has a fibrous root system and produces numerous small, narrow leaves that are often hairy. Commidendrum robustum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
